Returns: true if this test case can only be run in performance mode.
isPerformanceOnly().Description: This method is used to determine what modes this test case can run in.
isPerformanceOnly().history: Added in API level 1 Deprecated in API level 24

Returns: int Maximum number of iterations to run, or 0 to let the caller decide.
Parameters: PerformanceTestCase.Intermediates: Callback for sending intermediate results.
startPerformance(android.test.Performanc.Description: Set up to begin performance tests. The 'intermediates' is a communication channel to send back intermediate performance numbers -- if you use it, you will probably want to ensure your test is only executed once by returning 1. Otherwise, return 0 to allow the test harness to decide the number of iterations. If you return a non-zero iteration count, you should call @B_android#test#PerformanceTestCase#Intermediates#startTiming_E@ and @B_android#test#PerformanceTestCase#Intermediates#finishTiming_E@ to report the duration of the test whose performance should actually be measured.
startPerformance(android.test.Performanc.history: Added in API level 1 Deprecated in API level 24

ClassDesc: Use More complex interface performance for test cases. If you want your test to be used as a performance test, you must implement this interface.
